gcci.text: At a benchmark H100 price of $3.19/hr, hyperscalers can arbitrage hardware scarcity via spot markets and reserved capacity while smaller players face chip availability constraints, compressing their capex flexibility.

gtpi.text: With average input prices around $1.25 per million tokens, API price wars are forcing providers to compete on efficiency and routing, compressing margins and accelerating model selection toward cost-effective mixtures.

gagl.text: An annual load of 120 TWh for AI workloads implies significant grid strain in clusters, pushing regions to reevaluate nuclear and firm clean power to maintain reliability amid rapid capacity growth.

aipi.text: Macro sentiment remains constructive but cautious, with capex intensity and supply bottlenecks heightening bubble risk while efficiency gains and standardized APIs support sustainable growth.
